These scientists are on the front lines of the pandemic, testing patients’ samples for the coronavirus. But there are not enough of them.

abstract: The Red Cross in China seems like any other humanitarian group. But there is one crucial difference: it is funded and directed by the Chinese Communist Party.
headline: Coronavirus Diplomacy: How China’s Red Cross Serves the Communist Party
lead_paragraph: Donations flooded in to fight the virus devastating the city of Wuhan, and the ruling Communist Party directed them to a group it could trust: the Chinese Red Cross.

abstract: The magazine’s Ethicist columnist on whether you’re helping more people by having goods delivered or by going to the store yourself — and more.
headline: Amid Covid-19, Should I Shop for Myself or Opt for Delivery?
lead_paragraph: In this time of lockdown, is it more ethical to order necessary items for delivery or to go get them myself? There are risks to others in both scenarios — whether to the workers or myself and my family. Is ordering for delivery helping to provide work for the delivery people or burdening that system by taking time away from those at higher risk than me? Anne, Boston

abstract: The shift from in-person visits to telehealth appointments could be here to stay.
headline: Prenatal Care May Look Very Different After Coronavirus
lead_paragraph: At the beginning of my second trimester in late March, I was contacted by my obstetrician’s office and was told to come alone for my next ultrasound. At the appointment I learned that my next appointment would be almost two months later. I was incensed.

abstract: Under strict lockdown measures, asylum seekers and migrants on the streets of Brussels increasingly rely on residents for survival.
headline: ‘I Could Be One of Them’: Belgians Help Migrants Amid Coronavirus
lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — When Belgium went into lockdown in mid-March because of the coronavirus pandemic, the authorities emptied half of the country’s migrant detention centers to help prevent the spread of the virus, leaving hundreds of people without a home.

abstract: Dr. Anthony S. Fauci, the director of the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases, reported optimistic early trial results from a possible Covid-19 treatment.
headline: Coronavirus Drug Trial Shows ‘Significant, Positive’ Data, Fauci Says
lead_paragraph: Dr. Anthony S. Fauci, the director of the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases, reported optimistic early trial results from a possible Covid-19 treatment.

abstract: Fighting fears and travel bans, countries and businesses are trying to rescue summer vacation. At Airbus, signs of trouble emerge.
headline: As Coronavirus Deaths Spike, Brazil’s Leader Says, ‘So What?’: Live Updates
lead_paragraph: This briefing has ended. Read the latest developments in the coronavirus pandemic here.

abstract: Virtual sessions offer the intimacy — and comedy — of seeing patients and therapists in their personal environments.
headline: In Psychotherapy, the Toilet Has Become the New Couch
lead_paragraph: Every day since the onset of the coronavirus outbreak, friends and family have been checking in on me — and not just in the general way that we all seem to be checking in on the people we love. They worry that the kind of work I do might make me sick — emotionally, that is.

abstract: The pandemic threatens to plunge half a billion people into poverty. The U.N. says it has raised just $1 billion of the $90 billion needed to aid poor regions.
headline: As Coronavirus Sickens Mexican Workers, U.S. Presses Their Factories to Stay Open
lead_paragraph: 新冠病毒疫情最新消息

abstract: The tech giant signaled confidence by announcing another big stock buyback, but it declined to forecast sales for the current quarter.
headline: Apple’s First-Quarter Sales Are Up Despite Coronavirus Slowdown
lead_paragraph: The global economy is showing signs of collapse, yet Apple said that its sales continued to rise and that it was buying back another $50 billion in stock.

abstract: Deaths from COVID-19 in deprived areas of England was more than double that found in well-off locations, with London by far the worst affected, according to official figures released on Friday.
headline: COVID-19 Death Rate in Deprived Areas in England Double That of Better Off Places: ONS
lead_paragraph: LONDON — Deaths from COVID-19 in deprived areas of England was more than double that found in well-off locations, with London by far the worst affected, according to official figures released on Friday.

abstract: A devoted Yankees fan fell in love with the Washington Nationals. But Dr. Anthony S. Fauci concedes it’s going to be a while before he goes to another game.
headline: Fauci, Leading Fight Against Coronavirus, Misses Baseball, Too
lead_paragraph: Dr. Anthony S. Fauci, the federal government’s top infectious disease expert, spends 19-hour days helping to lead the fight against the coronavirus.

abstract: Denver Broncos star linebacker Von Miller tweeted Thursday night that he tested negative for the coronavirus two weeks after announcing he had been diagnosed with COVID-19.
headline: Broncos' Von Miller Says He's Recovered From COVID-19
lead_paragraph: Denver Broncos star linebacker Von Miller tweeted Thursday night that he tested negative for the coronavirus two weeks after announcing he had been diagnosed with COVID-19.

abstract: The W.H.O. extends the global health emergency as deaths near 240,000, and our New Delhi correspondent paints a portrait of a fearful city.
headline: Companies Sell the Blood of Recovered Coronavirus Patients for Exorbitant Prices
lead_paragraph: Some biotech companies are cashing in on the race to produce coronavirus antibody tests, taking blood samples from people who have been infected and selling them at exorbitant prices.

abstract: The European Investment Bank (EIB) said on Friday it would boost its cooperation with the World Health Organization (WHO) as it seeks to fight the COVID-19 pandemic around the world, in particular in vulnerable African countries.
headline: European Investment Bank Joins WHO in Pandemic Help for Africa
lead_paragraph: LONDON — The European Investment Bank (EIB) said on Friday it would boost its cooperation with the World Health Organization (WHO) as it seeks to fight the COVID-19 pandemic around the world, in particular in vulnerable African countries.

abstract: The project, announced by the C.D.C., will help trace patterns of transmission, investigate outbreaks and map how the virus is evolving, which can affect a cure.
headline: Labs Across U.S. Join Federal Initiative to Study Coronavirus Genome
lead_paragraph: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention on Thursday announced a national initiative to speed research into how the coronavirus was spreading around the country, bringing together at least 75 public health, academic and commercial institutions studying its genome.

abstract: In Wuhan, where the pandemic started, the police have threatened and interrogated grieving relatives. Lawyers have been warned not to help them sue.
headline: Coronavirus Survivors Want Answers, and China Is Silencing Them
lead_paragraph: The text messages to the Chinese activist streamed in from ordinary Wuhan residents, making the same extraordinary request: Help me sue the Chinese government. One said his mother had died from the coronavirus after being turned away from multiple hospitals. Another said her father-in-law had died in quarantine.

abstract: By some measures, it is winning the race, with four companies already testing their vaccine candidates on humans.
headline: China’s Coronavirus Vaccine Drive Empowers a Troubled Industry
lead_paragraph: China wants to beat the world in the race to find a coronavirus vaccine — and, by some measures, it is doing just that.

abstract: The technique aims to make a person’s cells churn out proteins that will stimulate the body to fight the coronavirus.
headline: A Coronavirus Vaccine Project Takes a Page From Gene Therapy
lead_paragraph: Researchers at two Harvard-affiliated hospitals are adapting a proven form of gene therapy to develop a coronavirus vaccine, which they expect to test in people later this year, they announced on Monday.

abstract: The group had provided President Trump a backdrop for his daily briefings while working to coordinate the government response to the pandemic.
headline: Administration to Phase Out Coronavirus Task Force
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Despite growing evidence that the pandemic is still raging, administration officials said on Tuesday that they had made so much progress in bringing it under control that they planned to wind down the coronavirus task force in the coming weeks and focus the White House on restarting the economy.

abstract: The streets have suddenly come alive, especially at night, in many areas where social distancing is impossible.
headline: As India Loosens Its Strict Lockdown, Coronavirus Deaths Jump Sharply
lead_paragraph: NEW DELHI — Part of India’s success in blunting the spread of the coronavirus had been a fierce lockdown that was zealously obeyed.

abstract: The president’s cure-can’t-be-worse-than-the-disease logic is clear: As bad as the virus may be, the cost of the virtual national lockdown has grown too high.
headline: Trump’s New Coronavirus Message: Time to Move On to the Economic Recovery
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Confronted with America’s worst public health crisis in generations, President Trump declared himself a wartime president. Now he has begun doing what past commanders have done when a war goes badly: Declare victory and go home.

abstract: The Home of the Whopper, Verizon and Amazon are among the relative few that haven’t been afraid to run ads near coverage of the coronavirus.
headline: News Outlets Want More Advertisers to Act Like Burger King
lead_paragraph: Most companies regularly take steps to make sure their ads don’t run near headlines that could upset potential customers. So news organizations weren’t surprised when advertisers canceled campaigns in recent weeks or demanded that their ads be placed far from coverage of the coronavirus pandemic, costing publishers significant revenue.

abstract: As the economy melts down, embattled conservatives are testing a political response: saying Democratic climate policies would bring similar pain.
headline: G.O.P. Coronavirus Message: Economic Crisis Is a Green New Deal Preview
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The coronavirus and the struggle to contain it has tanked the economy, shuttered thousands of businesses and thrown more than 30 million people out of work. As President Trump struggles for a political response, Republicans and their allies have seized on an answer: attacking climate change policies.
